channel.description: Recent content in Posts on muhannad0.github.io

item.title: Using Moto to mock test AWS services: A DynamoDB Example
item.description: Recently, I had to write some tests for functions that called AWS services in Python. I found the 'moto' library which provides mocks for a lot of the AWS services for your tests. This is a basic example of using moto to test DynamoDB operations.

item.title: Local Development Using Serverless Framework
item.description: A guide to setting up a local development environment for building serverless applications using the Serverless Framework

item.title: Building a Serverless Telegram Bot on AWS
item.description: Iâ€™ve always wanted to try out to build a small chat bot. So, I decided to take a serverless approach to it.

item.title: Completing the Cloud Resume Challenge
item.description: Mission Accomplished! I'd like to share how I was able to tick off all the tasks on the #CloudResumeChallenge.

item.title: Phase 5: Setting up CI/CD with Github Actions
item.description: Phase 5 of the #CloudResumeChallenge where I make use of Github Actions to run tests and deployments when an update is pushed to the code repository.

item.title: Phase 4: Using Infra as Code on AWS
item.description: Phase 4 of #CloudResumeChallenge where I try to deploy to AWS using infra-as-code. During the initial work to develop the resume website, I used the console to set things up. But knowing how to define them in a configuration file and use one or two commands to deploy all of it automatically, that saves a lot of time.

item.title: Phase 3: Building a Site Visit Counter with AWS API Gateway / Lambda / DynamoDB
item.description: Phase 3 of #CloudResumeChallenge where I develop a small application to handle a visit counter. This one was a huge learning curve for me and I share how I attempted to complete the task.

item.title: Using Docker to Setup Environments Quickly for Coding
item.description: Preparing your machine for dev work is always a time consuming thing. It sometimes gets in the way of trying to do the actual thing you set out to do. I want to share how I got started with learning a new language, framework etc without having to spend much time setting things up.

item.title: Notes about a Windows Dev Environment with Docker
item.description: Thought to share some of my experience trying to setup a development environment on Windows, running Docker, which is quite enjoyable.

item.title: Phase 2: Host a website on AWS S3
item.description: Phase 2 of #CloudResumeChallenge where I work to host a website on AWS.

item.title: Phase 1: Build a Resume Webpage
item.description: Phase 1 of #CloudResumeChallenge where I try and make what resembles a webpage.

item.title: The #CloudResumeChallenge
item.description: A look into the #CloudResumeChallenge and why I think its a great resouce to help getting started in the realm of cloud.

item.title: Using Github Actions to Deploy My Blog
item.description: In this post I'm going to explain how I'm deploying changes to this website using Github Actions.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: Who are you? What is this? Why?
